document.docAuthor: Wei, Nan, Jersabek, Christian D., Xu, Runlin & Yang, Yufeng
document.masterDocTitle: New species and records of Colurella (Rotifera: Lepadellidae) from South China, with a key to Chinese Colurella

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species and records of Colurella (Rotifera: Lepadellidae) from South China, with a key to Chinese Colurella

bibRefCitation.author: Chittapun, S. & Pholpunthin, P. & Segers, H.
bibRefCitation.refString: Chittapun, S., Pholpunthin, P. & Segers, H. (1999) Rotifera from peat-swamps in Phuket Province, Thailand, with the description of a new Colurella Bory de St. Vincent. International Review of Hydrobiology, 84, 587 - 593. https: // doi. org / 10.1002 / iroh. 199900052

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species was to date only recorded from the Oriental region, in Thale Noi Lake on Malay Peninsula of Thailand ( Segers & Pholpunthin, 1997 ), in coastal peat swamps in the Phuket Province of Thailand (
Chittapun et al ., 1999
; 2007 ; Segers & Chittapun 2001 ) and from Northeast India ( Sharma & Sharma, 2005 ; 2014 ). We found it at three sites on Qi’ao Island ( Tab. 1 ) in low number and at two sites in the Nandujiang River Estuary, Haikou, Hainan Province (sampled biannually, Tab. 1 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10 .
Colurella sanoamuangae Chittapun, Pholpunthin & Segers, 1999
. A , C . Right lateral view. B . Ventral view. Scale bars: A–B: 50 µm.

paragraph.emphasis:
TABLE 1. The distribution and ecological characteristic of studied
Colurella
species in China

caption.paragraph: Sa: salinity; WT: water temperature; WD: water depth; DS: distance from shore

subSubSection.paragraph:
Colurella sanoamuangae
is characterized by the posterior end of the lorica forming a triangular projection (lateral view), that overlays the foot aperture as a tongue-shaped structure (ventral/dorsal view) (
Chittapun et al ., 1999
). This seems to be a stable morphological feature, as far as can be judged from previous observations. Accordingly, a previous record under this name from Iran , with posteriorly rounded lorica ( Reihan Reshteh & Rahimian, 2014 ), probably represents another as yet undescribed species ( Jersabek & Leitner, 2013 ). According to our present knowledge,
C. sanoamuangae
is an endemic species widely distributed in the Oriental region.

Measurements. Body (N = 5 females ): lorica length 97.8–101.4 µm , lorica width 46.7–48.5 µm , lorica height 59.4–67.2 µm , anterior aperture width 45.8–48.2 µm , second foot pseudosegment 6.7–8.1 µm , third foot pseudosegment 7.9–10.1 µm , toe length 46.6–47.5 µm .
